intro: Chelonanthus viridiflorus, commonly known as the green-flowered chelonanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its flowers are usually visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role. Chelonanthus viridiflorus is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
